Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2011 02:03PM golfergrandma wrote: We're meeting our special needs daughter at the airport in March, so tell me about the VAD card?  The last time I went through security, they picked up on my prosthesis and I had to have a patdown.  Now I have two prostheses and don't want the hassle.  My hair began shedding today -- no clumps, just in my comb, but don't know when or if it will end!  We have a dinner party tomorrow night and don't know how much hair I'll have left!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 07:07AM golfergrandma wrote: Hi everyone!  Been away for several days and joined the February pals, but like this group better!  Jean H - you're such a hoot!  You should write a book about your bc experiences or have you already?  Appreciated the tips on wine and other spirits.  Have been having my glass of wine every afternoon with no SE's so guess I will continue.  Won't feel like it right after my tx.  Is anyone getting CMF?  Doesn't appear so.  So far I haven't lost my hair this goaround but tomorrow is day 14.  I chose a wig last week and noted the style number and color.  Have a wig from my previous tx for a fill-in.  My wig is synthetic, but since I wear my hair short, it does look real.  Tried on a long one to match the color and it seemed like soooo much hair.  Really sorry for the SE's everyone is experiencing.  My WBC was a little low the other day but above 1500 so guess I won't need neulasta yet.  Didn't realize what difficult SE's went with it.  Take care everyone!  God bless.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2011 06:23AM golfergrandma wrote: I was a 10 year survivor of her2neu bc and was diagnosed in December with ER PR +.  Had a mx and now on CMF chemo for 6 mos.  Since my second cancer was a different kind, I don't consider it a recurrence, but not sure.  After 10 years, I thought I was cured.  I was also on arimidex when I was diagnosed.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2011 03:04PM - edited Feb 2, 2011 03:06PM by golfergrandma Hi Lee,  Had my first CMF this morning and am not at all nauseous!  So happy about that!  But I am kind of dizzy and slept most of the afternoon.  Other than the dizziness, I feel good.  Hope this continues.  Wonder if I will lose my hair -- if it thins 50 percent, I might like it to all to go.  I color my hair and don't intend to go around gray.  Yuck.  Guess I'm just too vain.  The last time I lost my hair on AC I bought the most awesome wig that I wore most of the time when I went out.  Also, I enjoy my glass of wine in the afternoon and wonder if could continue that habit?  Probably not.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 06:06AM golfergrandma wrote: I had a tooth pulled last Thursday and am taking my last pennicilin (sp) pill which I thought would interact with my chemo meds but onc said not.  My scalp feels funny, kinda itchy and sensitive.  Day 14 was yesterday so am still waiting for the inevitable?  Onc said I might not lose all of my hair, but what good is a little?  Next week is #2 of CMF, 7 more to go!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2011 10:35AM golfergrandma wrote: slcst..I had wonderful luck with Miralax after tx #1.  Took the full dose and also drank some prune juice.  Dried prunes work well too.   Haven't lost any hair yet (day 18) but it's time to color it and I'm afraid to do it.  Am a blond, but very gray underneath!  I was not qualified for a BRCA test because I didn't get bc until I was 62.  Then I was diagnosed in December with a different kind of bc.  My first bc (10 years ago) was her2neu and this one was ER, PR +.  My gyn said it would compare to me and my sister having had bc.  Would really like to be tested, but it won't be covered and would cost $3300.  Am keeping all of you in my thoughts and prayers, and know you'll all get through this and beat this horrible disease!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo in January '11 JulieH leftfootforward

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2011 09:05AM golfergrandma wrote: I wear my wig when going out and have received many compliments on it.  It's a semi-short, straight style that is very flattering and younger looking.  Would like to wear my real hair this way, but think my it's too curly with many cowlicks.  Maybe my hair stylist will be able to duplicate it.  The color is also better for my complexion - a little darker than the light blond I wore before.  Seeing you all with growing hair is inspiring!  An adventure, but one we wouldn't have choose!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2011 09:21AM golfergrandma wrote: Haven't been here for awhile.  I colored what's left of my hair the other day and the color didn't take!  Now it looks sorta pink!  My last CMF tx was 7/18 so it should be all right to color my hair.  Any suggestions?  I do need to wear a wig because my hair is so thin.  I wear it when I go out, but not at home.  However, I thought that I would color my hair to look more like myself.  Haven't colored it since February.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2011 09:22AM golfergrandma wrote: Sandy - Your hair looks so cute! Can't wait 'til my hair starts to grow again and I can color it!  It's totally silver now and I hate it, but it's too thin to go without a wig or hat.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2011 02:04PM golfergrandma wrote: My answer above is a reply from page 337.  This is really an active thread!  I should probably not visit here until my hair starts growing again.  I had my last CMF tx Monday so it'll be awhile before I'll notice anything.  I didn't lose all of my hair, but what's left is very thin.  Soooo I wear a wig when I go out and hats for golf, since I have enough hair left to hang under a hat.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2011 07:47AM golfergrandma wrote: Hi everyone!  Just joining this topic.  Had my last CMF tx yesterday and have lost lots of my hair - it's very thin.  I do wear a wig when going out and a hat for golf - enough short hair shows under the hat.  Question:  When will my hair begin growing again?  And when can I color it!  Right now it's white, dry and just not good hair at all.  Very depressing!
